  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Executive Assistant to the Creative Director",
  "description": "Gem HR Consulting - We are experts in the field of human capital management across Industries, We offer specially designed strategic approaches to your business needs.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant to the Creative Director

Job Location:&nbsp;Agungi, Lekki - Lagos
Industry: Fashion
Work Schedule: Monday &ndash; Saturday (Proximity to the Island will be an advantage)

Job Description
Executive &amp; Administrative Support:


	Act as a trusted right-hand to the MD in managing schedules, coordinating meetings and setting weekly priorities.
	Prepare for and coordinate general meetings, including agenda preparation, logistics and refreshments.
	Manage internal and external communication, including calls, emails, guest reception and walk-in clients.
	Handle travel and logistics for the MD and team (where required).


Operational Oversight &amp; Departmental Coordination:


	Supervise and ensure smooth collaboration across all departments: Design/Creative Team, Production, HR/Admin, Office Support Staff.
	Serve as the MD&rsquo;s representative in overseeing day-to-day operations when they are unavailable.
	Track departmental performance, gather and compile monthly reports from all managers.
	Ensure all team activities and deadlines are executed in line with the MD&rsquo;s directives and brand goals.


Client Consultation Coordination:


	Engage prospective clients from the website or social media, guide them through the consultation process, and confirm payment.
	Schedule and coordinate consultation meetings, ensuring the presence of all relevant parties (Design Manager, Creative Director, and client).
	Lead consultation logistics, including virtual measurement sessions for remote clients.


Client Relations &amp; Sales Support:


	Receive and professionally manage client fittings, inquiries, feedback, and complaints.
	Coordinate with the Design and Production teams on order timelines, alterations, and approvals.
	Manage off-the-rack sales and promote ready-to-wear collections and jewelry.
	Confirm website orders, communicate estimated delivery times, and ensure terms and conditions are upheld.


Fashion &amp; Creative Brand Support:


	Collaborate on concept development, product research, and fashion-forward proposals.
	Support and manage photo shoots, content creation, and campaign execution.
	Work alongside the Social Media Strategist to ensure consistent, engaging content that aligns with the brand identity.
	Contribute strategic insights to drive brand visibility, collaborations, and business growth.


People &amp; Vendor Management:


	Liaise with the HR Manager on recruitment, onboarding, and manpower planning.
	Supervise facility staff (cleaners, security, office assistants) and ensure a polished, client-ready space at all times.
	Engage vendors and artisans on behalf of the MD for orders, fittings, and event support.
	Negotiate vendor contracts and follow up to ensure timely service delivery.


Finance &amp; Reporting:


	Manage company running costs, handle payroll, and assist with financial reporting and budgeting.
	Document and track daily sales across all brand arms.
	Maintain accurate records of all financial and operational activities.


Person Specifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor&#39;s Degree
	3&ndash;4 years of proven experience supporting C-level Executives in fashion or creative industries.
	Preferably Female for Gender balance
	Strong leadership and coordination skills with ability to manage cross-functional teams
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
	Ability to work independently, stay composed under pressure, and take initiative
	Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, Google Workspace, and basic project management tools
	Customer service orientation with a flair for fashion and trends
	High emotional intelligence and discretion when handling sensitive information


Salary
Very Attractive.

Method of Application
Interested and Qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;gemhrconsulting@zoho.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Human Resource Officer",
  "description": "HRBP Limited&nbsp;is a human resource management consulting company focused on delivering human resource solutions for various sizes of organizations in the areas of talent acquisition, development, management, outsourcing, organization planning, development, and improvement.

We provide full HR consultancy service regardless of client headcount or location in Nigeria. We deliver customized HR consultancy service for all sizes of organizations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Officer&nbsp;
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a dynamic, emotionally intelligent, and experienced HRofficer to serve in a mid-level HR generalist capacity within apeople-intensive environment.
	This individual will be deployed to a reputablecompany in Lagos and will play a key role in driving performance, managing change, building trust with operational teams, and enhancing employee engagement across all levels of staff.
	The ideal candidate must not only be knowledgeable in core HR practices but must also possess the confidence, presence, and resilience to lead difficult personalities, resolve sensitive people issues, and navigate complex staff dynamics with wisdom and tact.


Key Responsibilities


	Serve as the on-ground HR lead handling day-to-day human resource functions, including onboarding, staff engagement, compliance, and HR operations.
	Support and implement performance management processes, ensuring fair and effective appraisal practices across all staff levels.
	Interpret and analyze workforce data to generate insightful reports for decision-making and management briefings.
	Address employee relations issues proactively, mediating conflict and maintaining a culture of discipline, accountability, and trust.
	Guide line managers and supervisors in managing performance issues, attendance, misconduct, and team dynamics.
	Collaborate with senior management to identify talent gaps, recommend people solutions, and ensure business alignment of HR strategies.
	Ensure HR practices are compliant with local labourlaws, industry standards, and internal company policies.
	Lead sensitization on organizational values and people management etiquette, especially tailored to the realities of a security and logistics workforce.
	Drive HR initiatives around safety culture, employee well-being, and staff recognition in a demanding operational context.
	Act as a liaison between the consulting firm and the client organization on all HR service delivery matters.


Job Requirements
Education &amp; Certification:


	A Bachelor&#39;s degree in human resources, industrial relations, psychology, business administration, or a related field. Professional HR certification (CIPM, HRCI, SHRM, or equivalent) is an added advantage.


Experience:


	Minimum of 5 years post-NYSC HR generalist experience, preferably in fast-paced, blue-collar or operations-driven industries.
	Proven track record managing performance systems, disciplinary processes, and conflict resolution.
	Experience in HR analytics and interpreting people data to influence HR strategy and business outcomes.


Skills and Attributes:


	Smart, vibrant, and charismatic with a strong presence; able to command respect and influence even difficult or resistant individuals.
	Excellent communication skills&mdash;written and spoken English must be polished and professional.
	Strong emotional intelligence, listening skills, and the ability to de-escalate tensions in emotionally charged environments.
	Capable of exercising mature judgment, maintaining confidentiality, and resolving people issues pragmatically.
	Detail-oriented with strong administrative and organizational skills.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office tools (especially Excel and PowerPoint); experience with HRIS is a plus.


Working Condition:


	This is a client-facing, field-based role. The officer will be physically located at the client&#39;s office.
	Must be willing to work in an environment that includes semi-skilled personnel,operational teams, and physically demanding workforce dynamics.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hrbplimited@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",
